quizTitle: Agile Development or Agile Practices Quiz
quizSynopsis: This quiz tests your knowledge of Agile development principles and practices.

questions.question: What is Agile development?
answers: A software development methodology that emphasizes adaptability and collaboration
A programming language used for web development
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! Agile development is a methodology that emphasizes adaptability and collaboration.
questions.explanation: Agile development is an approach to software development that prioritizes customer feedback, flexibility, and collaboration among team members.

questions.question: Which of the following are Agile practices?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! Daily stand-up meetings, Test-driven development (TDD), and Sprint planning are Agile practices.
questions.explanation: Agile practices include daily stand-up meetings, TDD, sprint planning, and more, all aimed at improving collaboration and adaptability.

questions.question: What is the Agile Manifesto?
answers: A document that outlines the principles of Agile development
A code of ethics for software developers
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! The Agile Manifesto is a document that outlines the principles of Agile development.
questions.explanation: The Agile Manifesto is a foundational document that expresses the core values and principles of Agile development.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Agile development?
answers: Deliver a fully defined product at the end of the project
Respond to changing customer needs and deliver valuable software incrementally
Complete all project tasks on time and within budget
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct answer! The primary goal of Agile development is to respond to changing customer needs and deliver valuable software incrementally.
questions.explanation: Agile development prioritizes delivering working software frequently and adapting to customer feedback throughout the project.
